messages.maxlength500: The field must not contain more than 500 letters.
messages.no_special_chars: Only the following special characters are permitted: _*+":,&()!?-
messages.start_date_before_end_date: The start date must be before the end date
messages.max_length: The field must not contain more than {{count}} letters.

invalid_data_text: Your entries are not valid and cannot be saved.
alert_locked: This plan is currently being edited by {{name}}. Changes will not be saved!
alert_insufficient_permission: You do not have permissions to edit this plan
unsaved_changes_text: Your current changes to this site will not be saved.

name.title: Project name
name.subtitle: What will the project be called?
name.description: Give your project a name.The name will appear in the VE-Display and in the project/Good Practice overview.

partners.title: Project partners
partners.subtitle: Who is involved in the project?
partners.description-1: List all individuals involved in the project by name here. If the individuals are already registered on VE-Collab, they can be found in the drop-down menu. Unregistered partners can be entered manually. Individual steps (e.g. learning objectives, assessment and evaluation) can then be answered for each participant separately.
partners.description-2: If applicable, also list external participants (e.g. companies or other institutions) who are not directly involved in the planning and execution of the VE.
partners.tooltip: You can find tips for finding partners in the self-learning materials…

institutions.title: Institutions
institutions.subtitle: Which institutions are involved?
institutions.description: This field provides you with a better overview of the institutions involved as well as the relevant departments.
institutions.no_inst_in_profile: There are no institutions in the profile yet.

lectures.title: Courses
lectures.subtitle: In which classes will the VE be implemented?

target.title: Target groups & languages
target.subtitle: Which target groups is the VE designed for?
target.description: It is important to consider the target group in order to tailor the teaching/learning objectives and content of the VE to the learners. Asking about the participants' first languages and other languages can be important in identifying a lingua franca or establishing a multilingual setting.
target.tooltip: More about language(s) in VE can be found in the self-learning materials…
target.language_title: Which languages will (mainly) be spoken during the VE?
target.language_description: Consider the linguistic diversity in your groups and discuss how you can utilise this potential for the VE.
target.relevant_exp_placeholder: e.g. language skills, previous courses on the topic, etc.
target.degree_placeholder: Enter degree program(s), separate several by comma
target.languages_placeholder: Enter languages, separate several by comma

goals.title: Learning objectives & topics
goals.subtitle: 1. Which subject-related learning objectives should be achieved in the VE?
goals.tooltip: More about learning objectives can be found here in the self-learning materials...
goals.learningGoal_placeholder: Describe the learning objectives for learners of {{username}}
goals.2-title: 2. What other higher-level learning objectives are being pursued?
goals.2-subtitle: In addition to subject-related learning objectives, you can also promote higher- level competencies with your VE. Consider which common focal points you want to emphasize.
goals.2-tooltip: More about learning objectives can be found here in the self-learning materials...
goals.2-placeholder: select additional competencies or add new ones by typing
goals.3-subtitle: Consider which topics you want to address in your VE. These can be subject-specific or interdisciplinary and/or focus on a specific competence (e.g. intercultural communication).
goals.3-tooltip: For inspiration on subject-specific topics from various disciplines, you can find more here in the self-learning materials...

learningEnv.title: Digital learning environment
learningEnv.subtitle: In which digital learning environment does the VE take place?
learningEnv.description: Please specify which shared learning platform is available to your participants, e.g. a joint project page or shared padlet, or which individual platform each of the participating partners use. If applicable, also name the most important digital tools for your project, e.g. the video conferencing system or virtual environments you will be using.
learningEnv.tooltip: More about LMS can be found in the self-learning materials…
learningEnv.subtitle2: In which format(s) will the VE be carried out?
learningEnv.tooltip2: Click here to find out more about different formats in the e-learning modules…
learningEnv.description2: Please specify whether the collaborative components of the VE will take place exclusively synchronously (e.g., via video conference), asynchronously (e.g., via email, padlet, etc.) or if both synchronous and asynchronous phases are planned.
learningEnv.pysicalSupp: Is the VE accompanied / supplemented by physical mobility?

methodology.title: Methodological approach
methodology.subtitle: What methodological approach is your VE based on?
methodology.description: If none of the suggestions match your approach, you can also add individual entries.
methodology.tooltip: More about teaching methods can be found here in the self-learning materials…
methodology.placeholder: Select approaches or add new ones

evaluation.title: Assessment / Evaluation
evaluation.subtitle: How can the VE be assessed and evaluated during and/or after the VE?
evaluation.description: At this point, reflect whether your VE is more process- or product-oriented. Note whether an evaluation (of processes or products) of the VE is planned on your part. Additionally, select appropriate formative and/or summative evaluation methods.
evaluation.tooltip: More about assessment options can be found here in the self-learning materials…

checklist.title: Checklist
checklist.subtitle: Have you thought of everything?
checklist.description: Here are some important aspects you should clarify before starting with the content and didactic planning..
checklist.tooltip: More about the aspects of the checklist can be found here in the self-learning materials…
checklist.time_descr-1: Find time slots for the joint preparation of the VE. It is best to create a timetable.
checklist.time_descr-2: Find time slots for conducting the VE if synchronous meetings are planned.
checklist.topic_descr-1: Ensure that the topic(s) of the VE align with the module requirements/curriculum of all involved persons.
checklist.objectives_descr-1: Check that the teaching / learning objectives of the VE are consistentwith the module requirements/ curriculum of all involved persons.
checklist.media_descr-1: If you plan to use a shared LMS, make sure it is accessible at all participating institutions.
checklist.technic_descr-1: Check whether your institution has sufficient technical equipment to carry out the VE.
checklist.technic_descr-2: Look into resources for technical support during the VE at your institution.
checklist.guidelines_descr-1: Discuss how attendance and participation will be handled at your institutions and within the VE.
checklist.dataprotection_descr-1: Inform yourselves about the relevant data protection regulations at your institution/country.

step-names.no_good_practice_plans: No Good-Practice plans with phases available for import
step-names.select_steps_to_import: Select phases you wish to import from the Good-Practice plans
step-names.name: Name:
step-names.title: General outline
step-names.subtitle: General outline of the project
step-names.description: Create as many phases as you like and assign a time frameto each of them. Important: Each phase requires a unique name (e.g. Group Work Phase I, Group Work Phase II). The phases you define will serve as your structure and overview.. You can then elaborate them in the detailed planning.
step-names.tooltip_text: You can find detailed information on planning and different types and models of VE in the e-learning materials.

step-data.description: Now describe the individual phase more in detail. If you plan to submit the project as a Good Practice example, you should also describe the individual learning activities in more depth.
step-data.title: Phase: {{name}}
step-data.tooltip_text: More aspects of detailed planning can be found in the e-learning materials.
step-data.detail_activities: Do you want to elaborate on the learning activity(ies) in the Designer?

post-process.title: Post-processing
post-process.subtitle: Return here after completing the VE.
post-process.text_1: Would you like to share your VE as a Good Practice example with the community?
post-process.text_2: Everyone will be able to find, view, and use the plan as a source of inspiration for their own VEs.
post-process.abstract_task: Please write a brief abstract (about 5 lines) summarizing the key points (partners, content, process) of your VE.
post-process.reflection_task_1: What makes this VE a Good Practice example? What did you think went well? What were the challenges and how did you handle them? What would you do differently next time?
post-process.reflection_task_2: Please share your own experiences and the feedback from your learners here. If available, you can upload a file containing your evaluation results.
post-process.update_task_1: Did you change the initial plan for your VE during the implementation (e.g. for didactic and/or organizational reasons)? In this case, please adjust your plan accordingly (project planning, learning activity, etc.). Use the navigation bar above or click
post-process.update_task_2: to return to the general outline.
post-process.ve_model_task: Is your VE based on a known VE model? If so, which one? (This information will help us to improve VE-Collab in the future)
post-process.literature_task: Please provide references to relevant publications or upload articles that you would like to share with the community. Be mindful of potential copyright restrictions.

finish.title: Finished
finish.subtitle: Well done! You have successfully planned the VE.
finish.feedback_1: We'd love to hear your thoughts on VE-Designer or the platform! Please share them
